Intellectuals are also a prime tar- get of Islamic militants in troubled Algeria, where the year drew to a close without any sign of a solu- tion to its its two-year conflict. Violence erupted in February, 1992 when the government cancelled elections which Islamic funda- mentalists were set to win and imposed a state of emergency. Seventeen journalists and dozens of judges, teachers and artists were murdered in 1994, along with 40 tourists.
